title: Colombo Dockyard trading suspension deferred until Dec.
byline: Colombo Dockyard PLC yesterday said the Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka (SEC) has granted a deferment of the suspension of trading of its shares that was scheduled to take place on 10 September 2025.

title: The Kandy Hotels Co. sees public float rise to 23%
byline: The Kandy Hotels Co. (1938) PLC’s public holding rose to 23 percent as of 1 September 2025, from 15.98 percent at end-June, after non-public shareholders sold shares in the market last month.

title: Telcos to cut cost as SL embraces independent tower sharing
byline: Sri Lanka has moved to reshape its telecommunications landscape by allowing independent firms to own and manage critical infrastructure, a shift expected to cut costs for operators and accelerate digital access across the island.

title: Rajitha Senaratne produced before Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who is currently in remand custody, was produced before the Bribery Commission today to record a statement in connection with an ongoing corruption investigation.

title: Two killed in expressway crash near Mirigama
byline: A late-night collision between a lorry and a bowser transporting fuel claimed two lives near the Mirigama entrance of the Central Expressway, police today.

title: Sri Lanka seeks more time and space to address UNHRC concerns
byline: Asserting that Sri Lanka will remain engaged with the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC), Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath reportedly said yesterday that the government needs ‘more time and space’ to address issues raised by the UN body regarding the reconciliation process and alleged wartime rights violations, Daily Mirror learns.

title: ’Peace or War’: China’s Xi hosts massive military parade with Putin and Kim
byline: Chinese President Xi Jinping warned the world was facing a choice between peace or war as he held his country’s largest-ever military parade on Wednesday, flanked by Russia’s Vladimir Putin and North Korea’s Kim Jong Un.
